messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] socialization- the little ones
messages.msgSnippet: Eileen, I have the same situation with a support group here.  They gear everything towards the older children.  Needless to say I never go to anything, because
messages.messageBody:
Eileen,

I have the same situation with a support group here. They gear everything
towards the older children. Needless to say I never go to anything, because
I don't fit! All of my friends are gearing up for preschool next year two
days a week. Gee, that will leave possibly 3 days that we (and our children)
might have a chance to connect with each other. I sometimes wonder if these
same friends will continue to be my friend say 5 years down the road. A few
I know will, but I wonder about the others. They seem just a little too
excited about the prospect of shopping, lunching, volunteering, etc. while
their children are in preschool. They "can't wait until preschool starts"!!
Ugh! How can anyone want to be away from their child that much? Yes, I
know there are those days...but every week?

Michelle


>From: jazballard@...
>Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] socialization- the little ones
>Date: Wed, 1 Mar 2000 08:07:12 EST
>
>Michelle,
>Yes--not having anyone who can relate to what you want to do IS such a
>difficulty...
>EVERYONE here sends their kids to school, and I have yet to find a support
>group in my area....most of the people I find out about are a good 1 hr
>away..kind of hard to cultivate a relationship with a stranger that way...
>There is a group that does activities ect, but everything is for the older
>ages...nothing for little ones really..
>So this list is my support group...although not much interaction for my
>child...
>Altleast we have each other !!! Just knowing that I'm not alone in my
>feelings certainly does ALOT for me...
>Eileen
